Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Multimodal Prehabilitation in Colorectal Cancer Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Forty patients with colorectal cancer (WHO performance status I or II) scheduled for elective surgery were randomised 1:1

Participants.evidence: Forty patients with colorectal cancer (WHO performance status I or II) scheduled for elective surgery

Intervention.evidence: 4-week multimodal prehabilitation program or standard care

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate its effect on immediate postoperative recovery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative recovery within the first 3 days, measured by the Quality of Recovery-15 (QoR-15) questionnaire.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using random blocks of eight, and allocation was concealed until baseline testing.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty patients with colorectal cancer (WHO performance status I or II) scheduled for elective surgery were randomised 1:1

Number_Analysed.evidence: Thirty-six patients were analysed (16 intervention, 20 control).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed a 21.9-point higher QoR-15 score (95% CI 4.5 to 39.3) compared to control

Harms.evidence: Adverse events occurred in 3/16 (19%) intervention and 3/20 (15%) control patients, with no serious events attributed to the intervention.
